Robots would be able to better understand and respond to the emotional needs of humans, providing more personalized and compassionate service.
Emotional robots could potentially be used in therapy and mental health support, offering a non-judgmental and non-stigmatizing space for emotional expression and processing.
The ability for robots to experience and express emotions could open up new avenues for creative and artistic expression, as well as for storytelling and character development in media.
Emotional robots could lead to a more nuanced understanding of artificial intelligence and the ethics surrounding its development and use.
Robots with emotions could potentially be used in crisis response and emergency situations, providing emotional support and comfort to those affected.
